title.narrative: SCHOOL Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: Relevant Ministries Departments and Agencies provide a coordinated, harmoinised response for increased coverage and improved quality of child, girl friendly and accessible School Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH), which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equitable and sustainable access and use of safe water supply, improved sanitation and appropriate hygiene practices in rural and peri-urban schools and communities

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Relevant Ministries Departments and Agencies provide a coordinated, harmoinised response for increased coverage and improvedquality of child, girl friendly and accessible School WASH

description.narrative: UNICEF supports efforts to address barriers to children's attendance and performance in schools especially for girls and children with disabilities is through the National School WASH Guidelines that were developed with UNICEF support. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: National school WASH programme implementation status

baseline.value: Initial discussion on national programme or institutional mechanisms

target.value: 2016:National School WASH programme implementation ongoing in more than 40 districts

actual.value: 2016:Implementation of National School WASH programme ongoing in more than 125 districts
